title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 296-1.4 - Car pools
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 296-1.4 - Car pools

State Regulations
(a) A permit
holder will be permitted to form car pool arrangements at OGS paid parking
facilities. A permit holder may register car pools by identifying all the
license numbers of pool participants with the Bureau of Parking Services. Only
one vehicle will be allowed entrance to the facility on any given day. Entrance
will be authorized by the proper display of an OGS parking tag/decal for that
facility. Car pool participants must insure that the parking tag/decal is
transferred between members' vehicles in order to gain entrance to the
facility. (b) When the permit
holder loses parking authorization or no longer requires parking for whatever
reason, the permit, which is not transferable by the permit holder, will be
cancelled and car pool participants must make other parking arrangements. In
addition, the cancelled permit must be returned to the Bureau of Parking

Services. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
296-1.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
